name: intarsia
content:
Add to word list

fabrics & fashion
  specialized a style of knitting (= making something by using two long needles to connect wool into joined rows) that involves creating patterns with several colours that appear to fit into each other: Knitting intarsia does not require any special skills. Intarsia knitting enables you to introduce a number of areas of colour in any shape and size to the background.
a style of making something from wood or stone with a decorative pattern made from pieces of material of different colours and shapes that fit into a frame: Intarsia uses varied shapes, sizes, and species of wood to create a mosaic-like picture. These slabs of marble could be cut as pieces for floor mosaic or intarsia. an intarsia table/floor
More examplesFewer examplesWith intarsia, unlike other multicolour techniques such as Fair Isle, there is only one "active" colour color on any particular stitch.Bobbins are very useful for the intarsia technique.A stone to be used in an intarsia floor must meet certain standards of colour.Intarsia pavements require highly developed stone-working techniques.
